title_translation.en: Jagadish Chandra Bose: The First Biophysicist
title_translation.es: Jagadish Chandra Bose: El Primer Biof√≠sico

content_translation.en:
At the end of the nineteenth century, while extensive research was being conducted in advanced laboratories in Europe and America, Jagadish Chandra Bose was fighting alone for innovation in India's science-desert. The path we are slowly beginning to walk on today for scientific discovery was prepared by Jagadish Chandra through half a century of difficult dedication.

When Guglielmo Marconi of Italy and Karl Ferdinand Braun of Germany were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics at the end of 1909, the whole world came to know that the wireless communication system had been invented. However, Bengali scientist Jagadish Chandra Bose started fundamental research on radio waves much earlier than Marconi. He was the first in the world to successfully produce artificial microwaves in 1895. Along with revolutionary discoveries in physics, Jagadish Chandra initiated research on sensitivity. He was the one who experimentally proved that plants also respond to stimulus.

Jagadish Chandra, a seeker of multifaceted science, had earned proper recognition in the assembly of world scientists. In 1927, London's Daily Express mentioned him as equal to Galileo and Newton. According to Albert Einstein, 'For the facts Jagadish Chandra has given for the advancement of science, monuments should be erected for any one of them.'
content_translation.es:
A finales del siglo XIX, cuando se estaba realizando una extensa **research** en **laboratories** avanzados de **Europe-America**, en ese momento en el **science-desert** de India, Jagadish Chandra Bose luchaba solo por la **innovation**. El camino por el cual hoy comenzamos lentamente a caminar hacia el **scientific discovery**, ese camino fue preparado por Jagadish Chandra con medio siglo de ardua **dedication**.

A finales de 1909, cuando a Guglielmo Marconi de Italia y Karl Ferdinand Braun de Alemania se les otorg√≥ el **Nobel Prize** en F√≠sica, todo el mundo supo que el **wireless communication system** hab√≠a sido inventado. Pero el **scientist** bengal√≠ Jagadish Chandra Bose comenz√≥ la **research** fundamental sobre **radio waves** mucho antes que Marconi. √âl fue el primero en el mundo en lograr con √©xito la producci√≥n de **microwave** artificial en 1895. Junto con **discoveries** revolucionarios en f√≠sica, Jagadish Chandra inici√≥ la investigaci√≥n sobre **sensitivity**. Las plantas tambi√©n responden al **stimulus**, este hecho lo demostr√≥ √©l **experimentally**.

Jagadish Chandra, buscador de ciencia multifac√©tica, hab√≠a obtenido el **recognition** apropiado en la asamblea de cient√≠ficos mundiales. En 1927, el Daily Express de Londres lo mencion√≥ como **equal** a Galileo y Newton. Seg√∫n Albert Einstein, 'Por los hechos que Jagadish Chandra ha dado para el avance de la ciencia, se deber√≠an erigir **monuments** por cualquiera de ellos.'
